data.title: Meet the C-Suite Executive Team of Intuit Inc. [2024]
data.meta_description: Intuit, a publicly traded and Nasdaq-listed business software company, was founded by Scott Cook and Tom Proulx in 1983 with
data.text:
Intuit, a publicly traded and Nasdaq-listed business software company, was founded by Scott Cook and Tom Proulx in 1983 with an aim to offer specialized financial software not only for individuals but also for businesses of all sizes. Since its commencement, Intuit has launched various software products, including TurboTax, a tax preparation application, and QuickBooks, an accounting application for small businesses. With its cutting-edge, innovative, and highly user-friendly financial products, this leading software company has now successfully acquired over 100 million customers globally.

Empowering individual customers and small & medium size businesses to overcome critical financial challenges; Intuit has a specialized team of c-suite executives led by Sasan Goodarzi. In this article, we’ll delve into the c-suite executive team of Intuit, an American software company, who is the driving force behind the huge success of this technology startup and has a robust team of over 17000 employees globally, enabling it to drive nearly 13 billion of annual revenue.

Meet the C-Suite Executive Team of Intuit [2024]

1. Sasan Goodarzi – CEO

Sasan Goodarzi has been serving as the chief executive officer of Intuit since January 2019. Goodarzi focuses on driving the company in the right direction so that it can achieve the mission of empowering prosperity in the world. In his over 14 years of career at this American business software company, Sasan has held various leadership roles in each of the largest businesses of Intuit. Most recently, he held EVP and GM roles at Small Business and Self-Employed Group. He also served as EVP and GM of Consumer Tax Group, CIO and GM of ProTax Organization, and GM of the Financial Service Division.

Before Intuit, Goodarzi was the global president of Invensys, a leading industrial automation, transportation, and control technology company. Additionally, he held many leadership roles at Honeywell and served as CEO and co-founder at Lazer Cables Inc. Currently, he is a co-founder at Goodarzi Foundation and a board member at Atlassian. He received his bachelor’s degree from the University of Central Florida and an MBA from Northwestern University.

Related: Are CEOs Overrated & Overpaid?

2. Scott Cook – Co-Founder & Chairman

Co-founded Intuit, a business software company, in 1983, Scott Cook serves as an executive committee chairman. Being a chief innovator, Scott is responsible for working with small teams across the organization, helping them gain deeper customer empathy and develop innovative software solutions that are capable of solving their real financial problems. Before co-founding one of his most successful businesses, Intuit, Cook handled consulting projects across banking, food services, and technology on behalf of Bain & Company, a well-known corporate consultancy firm.

Moreover, he worked at Procter & Gamble for around four years. Scott currently serves as a member of the board of directors of Procter & Gamble, part of the advisory board at the Center for Brand and Product Management, and president of Intuit Scholarship Foundation. He earned an MBA from Harvard University and a bachelor’s from the University of South California.

Related: How to Become the Chairman of a Company?

3. Lara Balazs – EVP & CMO

Lara Balazs has been appointed as EVP and CMO of Intuit. She is also a GM of the Strategic Partner Group at Intuit, a well-established platform enabling customers and communities worldwide to discuss their most important financial challenges. As Intuit’s chief marketing officer, Lara is responsible for designing and deploying innovative marketing and branding strategies to attract new customers and retain the trust of existing ones. Moreover, being a general manager of Intuit’s Strategic Partner Group, she leads the ProConnect Pro-tax group and handles strategic partnerships to offer industry-leading benefits to customers.

She also has a pivotal role in corporate responsibility, which includes a strong focus on diversity and inclusion, and making a positive impact on the environment. Before coming to Intuit, Balazs served as CMO at Ridge Ventures, VP of worldwide Prime & North America marketing at Amazon, and SVP, head of North America marketing (previously head of global innovation marketing) at Visa. She earned a bachelor’s degree from the University of Washington and an MBA from Northwestern University.

Related: Personality Traits of Chief Marketing Officers

4. Michelle Clatterbuck – CFO

Responsible for leading the global finance team, Michelle Clatterbuck is the chief financial officer of Intuit. She is pivotal in designing and strengthening the financial strategy and operations across the organization, including treasury, procurement, and investor relations. Michelle joined Intuit in 2003 and has been appointed to various executive roles, including SVP of finance of Small Business Group and Consumer Tax Group. She has also held other executive roles, like SVP of finance for the Accounting Professionals Division and Intuit Healthcare.

Before Intuit, Michelle held several leadership roles at General Electric, including finance manager at GE Fanuc. Clatterbuck served in a financial litigation consultant role at Petersen Consulting, the Barrington Consulting Group. Michelle holds a bachelor’s degree in finance from the University of Virginia.

Related: CFO OKR Examples

5. Anton Hanebrink – CCS&DO

The EVP and chief corporate strategy & development officer, Anton Hanebrink, enables Intuit’s long-term success by defining critical strategies, including inorganic activities. Anton leads the strategic pillars of Intuit and has led over $20 billion of acquisitions, including Mailchimp and Credit Karma. Besides holding a leadership role at Intuit, Hanebrink has served as head of corporate development at Square, senior associate at Opus Capital, and strategy and corporate development at Hewlett-Packard. Anton earned a bachelor’s degree from Washington University and MBA from the Wharton School.

The C-suite team of Intuit also involves the following executives:

6. Varun Krishna – EVP & GM, Consumer Group

7. Kenneth Lin – CEO & Founder, Credit Karma

8. Marianna Tessel – EVP & Chief Technology Officer

9. Mark Notarainni – EVP & Chief Customer Success Officer

10. Alex Chriss – EVP & GM, Small Business & Self-Employed Group

11. Kerry McLean – EVP, General Counsel, & Corporate Secretary

Conclusion

Intuit’s c-suite comprises diversified, experienced, and innovative leaders, bringing their expertise and industry knowledge together to shape the company’s long-term success and assist its global consumer and corporate clients in overcoming their most critical financial challenges. As the company continues to focus on developing strong customer empathy and developing innovative solutions, Intuit is likely to see favorable growth and gain market position in the coming years.
